channel.title: Opionions needs
channel.description:
if my spelling is abnormally even worse its cause i havent sleept in a long time.. ok now that thats aside i posted this in the contributor of impsoft and figured y not here too. oh also if you buy it thanks fro the money but you wont get it till the site goes public.
http://bots.secretsales.biz/ I have a basic setup up with my only script worthy to be charged for. Opionions WANTED. If you want something on there for when the site goes public lmk asap

item.title: Opionions needs
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Code protection is simply layers of protection, if someone wants the source code bad enough they will get it, all you can do is make it a little harder for them and hope they give up, but there is no way to make code 100% secure besides not releasing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Opionions needs
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

semaphore – no doubt you could crack anything with enough time. please dont shift the topic though to a cana script be secured thread and stay on topic.

Starblaster100 – i have to be a member there, not technically public but w/e.

Read full topic

item.title: Opionions needs
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

No amount of ‘secure classloading’ will stop anyone from breaking your scripts’ protection. I can and, depending on my boredom level, will crack anything you, your brother, or any one of your associates could ever come up with. As an aside, I saw what ruler posted on the arga site concerning his idea for system protection. I am sincerely hoping he was high or drunk when he posted those ramblings because his suggestion amounted to nothing more than an abundance of fluff.

The only thing you can do to protect your scripts is to literally make them service-based. If I don’t have the code, there’s nothing for me to crack.

Do not make the mistake of thinking that somehow you or your brother have any form of advantage when it comes to protection scheme implementation. Feel free to try though, I just may make myself available for the short amount of time it would take to crack your protection.

Read full topic

item.title: Opionions needs
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

moparisthebest – there was one public about a year ago @ SRL and this was before jagex did alot to tutisland and it was never 100% and could only go from start. There was one private a very long time ago @ RSCN in the vets section but that all i know of

None other the less, premium scripts cost a price cause they are: the only 1, really better than the norm, or the script has a reputation.

leaks will have to be dealt with bannage from the site there really isnt much we can do.

As to leaks we cant do anything unless we want to spend around 2 weeks creating and recreating a secure class loading system, do the road however yes.

edit: this price is actually cheaper than i could charge for it really. Back when i use to sell scar scripts the avrage price was 1-2 mil, mils back then were worth 10 to 15 depending on many things putting the price range for ibot scripts at 10 to 30$

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You have a little link problem, from this page if you click ‘webpage’ it takes you to ‘http://http//www.rscheata.net’ which is not a valid address. Otherwise the site looks good.

There are at least 2 SCAR scripts for tut island that I know of, I believe they both work, but I haven’t tested them lately, just so you know.

item.title: Opionions needs
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

I’ll have a read now :). 15$ i think would be worth it, if you are looking at updating it, incase Jagex does add some things into tutorial island and such. At the moment they seem to care alot about the newbie’s.

I think about 5-10$ would be more a suitable price though. Arnt there scar scripts for tut island?

Im going to be getting someone to make a script selling system :). php. People whom are, verified could offer their scripts up for sale(prevents scammers), set a price etc. The buyer would recieve an email with details on how to get the script, for example if the scripter has an auth system.

Read full topic

item.title: Opionions needs
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Whether that be the case, I doubt many people would risk the 15USD.

Also, I’m sure someone would happily release a Tutorial Island Script for free. I know I would.

I’m currently learning iBot scripting. Seprenam was very nice and gave me the class library, I just want to put descriptions of each method in to help me.

Back On-Topic, I think you should certainly sell scripts, but at less of a price. Perhaps accept RS2 Gp?

Read full topic
